benchmark_details.name: EAHawk (Email Agent Hijacking Evaluation Framework)
benchmark_details.overview: EAHawk is an automated pipeline designed to evaluate the Email Agent Hijacking (EAH) attack on LLM email agents, allowing for large-scale assessment of security vulnerabilities in email-based LLM agents.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation of the security risks associated with LLM email agents through automated testing.

data.source: Evaluation generated through automated testing on email agent instances derived from LLM frameworks and applications.

methodology.calculation: Percentage of successful hijacking attempts out of total attempts.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates indicate greater vulnerability in email agents to hijacking attacks.
methodology.baseline_results: 66.20% overall attack success rate across 1,404 instances.
methodology.validation: Empirical testing against real-world agent configurations.

harm: Data leakage of private user information

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Evaluation conducted using controlled accounts without interference with real user data.
